Key Match Events: Jackson Chourio hit a tying home run in the third inning.
Jackson Chourio hit a tying double in the fifth inning.
The Cardinals intentionally walked Jackson Chourio in the 10th inning.
Blake Perkins struck out to end the Brewers' threat in the 10th inning.
The Cardinals scored in the 11th and 12th innings, leading to a 7-4 loss for the Brewers.
Willy Adames hit an RBI double in the 11th inning to tie the game 4-4.
Elvis Peguero surrendered three runs in the 12th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers manager Pat Murphy praised Jackson Chourio's performance.
Pat Murphy expressed frustration over the Brewers' quiet offense in the late innings.
Pat Murphy credited the Cardinals' pitching for their performance.
Aaron Civale reflected on his performance, noting a desire to adjust quicker next time.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers inched closer to playing October baseball for the sixth time in the last seven years.
A Cubs loss kept the Brewers 10 games atop the National League Central with 23 games to play.
